member.name: T:System.Rules.IScope
member.summary: Concept from the xLim2. That's simple nesting logger that is used by the validation rules.

remarks.para: It has logical the extensibility (not implemented, because there does not seem to be any need) for maintaining the error level in attached and detached scopes. Warnings, Fatals or Info messages could be added here (full ILogScope if needed).
Same extensibility could be turned on for capturing detailed validation info on complex long-running validation scenarios (you'd hate to debug these).
Note, that in order to maintain .NET 2.0 compatibility, is is recommended to use interface-declared methods instead of the extensions (or use some extension weaver).

member.name: M:System.ExceptionHandlerSyntax.CircuitBreaker(System.Syntax{System.ExceptionHandler},System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)

summary.para: Builds the policy that will "break the circuit" after exceptions that could be handled by the being built. The circuit stays broken for the . Any attempt to invoke method within the policy, while the circuit is broken, will immediately re-throw the last exception.
If the action fails within the policy after the block period, then the breaker is blocked again for the next . It will be reset, otherwise.

member.param: How much time the breaker will stay open before resetting
How many exceptions are needed to break the circuit
member.remarks: (see "ReleaseIT!" for the details)
